rdf:Description.lla:note: Apprenticeship expired on 5th May 1862 while at sea
Died of Yellow Fever - was taken ill on 5th September - was visited by a doctor, became delerious but expired on 7th September
Was taken ill apparently of Yellow Fever on 29th August and conveyed to hospital where he remained until September 10th, when he returned on board
Thomas Richards was taken ill of Yellow Fever on Sept 1st at his lodgings in Bermuda and was visited by a doctor. Fever abated and on Thurs September 15th returned on board ship - recovered

Thomas Evans, late Master of the 'Catherine Anne' now laying in this port (St George, Bermuda) has this day taken command of the brig 'Laura' in the place of Thomas Richards the late master who is not sufficiently recovered to take charge of the vessel and have left him to bring my vessel - Catherine Anne home when loaded. This is agreed to by Capt Richards. I cannot get the Articles endorsed to this effect without going into the centre of the town whewre the fever is raging and I might take it the ship will be detained.
